intro: Trichospermum caribaeum, commonly known as the Caribbean milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Trichospermum caribaeum is adapted to coastal and sandy soils, making it a common sight in tropical and subtropical environments.
